intro: Schleidenia incana, commonly known as the gray hairweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its grayish-blue foliage, which is covered in fine, hairy structures. Schleidenia incana typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often arranged in dense clusters, and it is adapted to withstand saline and arid conditions.
